pageContext.claim: “I've learned because, with the fake news, if you tell a joke, if you're sarcastic, if you're having fun with the audience, if you're in live television with millions of people and 25,000 people in an arena, and if you say something like, ‘Russia, please, if you can, get us Hillary Clinton's emails. Please, Russia, please. Please get us the emails! Please!’ So everybody's having a good time, I'm laughing, we're all having fun. And then that fake CNN and others say, ‘He asked Russia to go get the emails.’ Horrible.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump in previous comments has said earnestly that he wanted Russia to release Hillary Clinton's emails. In July 2016, he said it gave him "no pause" to call for these emails' release.
